sub_title: Founder & consultant, Super73 | Metos | Husk & Stone | Circularity in⚡️micromobility & energy | batteries & second-life
summary:
Entrepreneurial builder & advisor experienced in circularity, urban mobility, and renewable energy. I cofounded Super73 (2016), a California lifestyle brand and maker of iconic electric motorbikes, with my last role up to 2022 was Head of Sustainability. 

With 12 years in the urban mobility space, i'm currently building my next ventures and consulting activity from Amsterdam. Driven by the desire to create and achieve impactful strategies designed for positive societal & environmental change, my interests lie in creating partnerships, accelerating collaboration, developing business and trade within the mobility value chain, the energy market and startup ecosystems.

Over a decade of experience in early growth startups in the US, Europe, and Asia. Fluid in multidisciplinary and global insights, quick to understand complex business models, and thriving on a steep learning curve. I especially value growth through transparency, empathy, clear communication, and powerful storytelling. Capable of bridging organizational and cultural gaps across teams thanks to a solid education in industrial design where the creative approach is applied to methodology and process design. 

When I'm not working you can find me playing beach volleyball, cooking for friends, gardening, "boating" in Amsterdam, arts & crafts, dreaming and crafting new business ideas.

SUPER73, Inc. (previously known as Lithium Cycles) In Spring of 2016, the SUPER73® electric motorbike was launched on Kickstarter, which has quickly grown into the most popular e-bike on the Internet. As a team, we love bikes and motorcycles. Our goal was to design a new kind of electric hybrid with cutting edge technology, that was inspired by the rich heritage of motorcycle culture. At Super73, our mission is to build high quality electric motorbikes that are fun and easy to ride.
